channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber at the BBC
channel.desc: To mark his 75th birthday, Andrew Lloyd Webber takes a nostalgic journey through the BBC archives, looking back on some of his biggest and best-loved songs.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Andrew Lloyd Webber
channel.desc: Alan Yentob talks to Andrew Lloyd Webber about his autobiography, bohemian childhood and the memories he has chosen to reveal.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Cynthia Erivo
channel.desc: Multi-award-winning star of stage and screen Cynthia Erivo takes the Proms by storm as she sings the great American songbook of the 1950s and 60s.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Showstoppers
channel.desc: Gary Wilmot hosts as guests David Essex, Katia and Marielle Lab?que, Twiggy Lawson and Nigel Planer perform songs from musicals. With the BBC Concert Orchestra.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Showstoppers
channel.desc: Gary Wilmot presents songs from musicals. He is joined by guests Robson and Jerome, Bob Monkhouse, Paul Nicholas and Kim Wilde. With the BBC Concert Orchestra.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Great British Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael is heading for Farnborough, Hampshire, famous today for its airshow and home to what was then the Royal Aircraft Establishment.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Wainwright Walks
channel.desc: Julia Bradbury explores the work of fell walker and author Alfred Wainwright. She aims to reach the summits of Crinkle Crags and Bowfell in Lakeland.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: PQ 17
channel.desc: Jeremy Clarkson tells the story of the Arctic convoys of WWII, which delivered vital war supplies to the Soviet Union via the Arctic, and reveals the convoy's greatest disaster.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Laurence Rees Remembers... The...
channel.desc: Nazis: A Warning from History. Laurence Rees looks back on the 1997 documentary series The Nazis: A Warning from History.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Nazis
channel.desc: Documentary series examining how Hitler came to power. By January 1933, Germany had voted for a chancellor who was openly opposed to democracy.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Rise of the Nazis
channel.desc: Delving into the corridors of power where Germany's top political mastermind sees an opportunity to use the popularity of the Nazis for his own ends.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The War Lords
channel.desc: Series in which historian AJP Taylor describes the careers of the 'war lords' who dominated WWII. In this episode, he examines the role of Winston Churchill.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The War Lords
channel.desc: Series in which historian AJP Taylor describes the careers of the 'war lords' who dominated WWII. In this episode, Taylor evaluates Stalin's role in the conflict.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Living with Lockerbie
channel.desc: Glenn Campbell marks the 25th anniversary of the Lockerbie bombing by exploring its impact on victims' relatives, witnesses, emergency teams and investigators.

channel.desc: Sitcom about a British government minister. Jim Hacker wants to implement some cost-cutting initiatives - but Sir Humphrey does not approve.

channel.title: Simon Schama's Power of Art
channel.desc: Simon Schama wonders how Gian Lorenzo Bernini's Ecstasy of St Thereza, which depicts a nun in the state of orgasmic bliss, was ever allowed to get past the censors.

channel.title: Barbara Hepworth
channel.desc: A profile of Barbara Hepworth, the world's first internationally celebrated woman sculptor.

channel.title: The Singing Detective

channel.title: The Singing Detective

channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: Calum tickles a few trout, Tricki Woo enters the dog show, and Bramble, the cow with a wink, is a success.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: All Creatures Great and Small
channel.desc: James visits Granville Bennett's lavishly impressive small-animal hospital, the fruits of which are evidently much richer than the hard-grafting life of James's practice.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Brian Cox Remembers... Bob Servant
channel.desc: Actor Brian Cox takes a fond look back on a character who occupies a very special place in his heart, the would-be MP for Broughty Ferry, Bob Servant.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: A radio appearance leads to a visit from the police and protests from local dog owners. Contains some strong language.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: The by-election favourite Nick Edwards arrives and Bob is determined to derail him. Contains some strong language and adult humour.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Bob Servant
channel.desc: Looking for a campaign boost, Bob courts the religious vote and Broughty Ferry's women. Contains some strong language and adult humour.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Mark Lawson Talks to Brian Cox
channel.desc: Brian Cox talks about his passion for portraying complex and difficult characters, his personal psychological battles and the low point in his career when he almost gave up acting.
